page.title: 13Watford's Housing.
page.content: In the Holy Rood area there are many types of housing. The different houses around are mostly semi-detached, terraced and detached. Some of the detached are very big and a lot sell for 90,000 or more. The new M25 has made Watford a very popular place to live. Also Watford railway Junction is a mainline railway station with fast trains to London. Some of the old lodges from the big Estates are still used-the Grove and Russells House are near Holy Rood School. Also next to the school are Council Houses for Policemen and Firemen. An average family house has 3 bedrooms, a kitchen, a dining room, a living room, a bathroom, toilet and garden. There are also flats and bungalows close to the school. Watford Council owns many houses, the rest are private.
